meanings.definition: The act of moving in a lively or bouncy manner.
meanings.sent1: She added flouncings to her dance routine to make it more fun.
meanings.sent2: The children's flouncings around the playground brought smiles to the adults' faces.
meanings.sent3: During the game of tag, his flouncings made him look like a playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: Her flouncings on the trampoline resembled a joyful bird taking flight.
meanings.sent5: The flouncings of the balloons in the wind created a festive atmosphere at the party.

meanings.definition: Exaggerated or dramatic movements or gestures.
meanings.sent1: The actor's flouncings on stage captivated the audience's attention.
meanings.sent2: Her flouncings during the argument made her point seem even more intense.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's flouncings while telling jokes added humor to the performance.
meanings.sent4: His flouncings in the dance routine were like waves crashing on the shore.
meanings.sent5: The flouncings of the magician's hands mesmerized the crowd.

meanings.definition: Excessive or showy decorations or embellishments.
meanings.sent1: The room was filled with flouncings of glitter and sequins for the party.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was adorned with flouncings of lace and ribbons.
meanings.sent3: The cake was covered in flouncings of colorful frosting and edible pearls.
meanings.sent4: The garden was transformed with flouncings of fairy lights and paper lanterns.
meanings.sent5: The Christmas tree sparkled with flouncings of ornaments and tinsel.
